title: Augusta County: Jedediah Hotchkiss to Sara A. Hotchkiss, June 28, 1863
summary: Hotchkiss describes the people and provisions the Confederate Army finds in Carlisle, Pennsylvania, and the lack of military opposition in the vicinity.
keywords: Church/Religious Activity, Troop Movement, Medicine/Hospitals, African Americans, Slavery, Home Front, Military Authority, Patriotism, National Government, American Civil War
